member.name: T:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo
member.summary: A that provides extensible properties and methods. This stores 'extra' properties in a dictionary or checks the actual properties of the instance. This means this extendo can be subclassed and either native properties or properties from values in the dictionary can be retrieved. Three ways to access properties are available: Directly: any explicitly declared properties are accessible Dynamic: dynamic cast allows access to dictionary and native properties/methods Dictionary: Any of the extended properties are accessible through the interface

member.name: F:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.mInstance
member.summary: Instance of an object passed in.

member.name: F:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.mInstanceType
member.summary: Cached type of the instance.

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.#ctor
member.summary: This constructor just works off the internal dictionary and any public properties of this object.

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that allows passing in an existing object instance to 'extend'.
member.remarks: You can pass in null here if you don't want to check native properties and only check the Dictionary.
member.param: Instance of the object to extend

member.name: P:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.InstancePropertyInfo
member.summary: Returns an array of objects.

member.name: P:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.Properties
member.summary: Returns a dictionary of properties.

member.name: P:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.Item(System.String)
member.remarks: The getter checks the Properties dictionary first and then looks in PropertyInfo[] for properties. The setter checks the instance properties before checking the Properties dictionary.
member.returns: An object

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.Contains(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether a property exists in the Property collection or as a property on the instance.
member.param: If true, include fields of the Extendo based object itself in the search
member.returns: Boolean, true if a property exists with the given name

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve a member by name first from instance properties followed by the collection entries.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the operation was successful

member.summary: Dynamic invocation method. Currently allows only for Reflection based operation (no ability to add methods dynamically).
member.param: Arguments to use when calling the member
member.returns: Boolean, true if the operation was successful

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.Extendo.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Property setter implementation that tries to set the value on the passed in instance first then into this object.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the operation was successful

member.summary: Returns all properties.
member.param: If true, include fields of the Exptendo based object itself
member.returns: A collection of s

member.summary: Reflection Helper method to retrieve a property.
member.param: The instance to retrieve the property from (use null to use this instance)
member.returns: Boolean, true if the operation was successful

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.FastList`1.BinarySearch(`0)
member.summary: Searches the entire list for the given element, using the generic interface implemented by each element of the list and by the specified object.
member.returns: The index of the specified value in the list, if value is found; otherwise, a negative number. If value is not found and value is less than one or more elements in the list, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of the index of the first element that is larger than the value. If value is not found and value is greater than all elements in array, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of (the index of the last element plus 1). If this method is called with a non-sorted list, the return value can be incorrect and a negative number could be returned, even if the value is present in the list

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.FastList`1.BinarySearch(`0,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`0})
member.summary: Searches the entire list for the given element using the specified generic interface.
member.param: The implementation to use when comparing elements or null to use the implementation of each element
member.returns: The index of the specified value in the mList, if value is found; otherwise, a negative number. If value is not found and value is less than one or more elements in the list, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of the index of the first element that is larger than the value. If value is not found and value is greater than all elements in array, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of (the index of the last element plus 1). If this method is called with a non-sorted list, the return value can be incorrect and a negative number could be returned, even if the value is present in the list

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.Generic.FastList`1.BinarySearch(System.Int32,System.Int32,`0,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`0})
member.summary: Searches a range of elements in the list for the given element, using the specified generic interface.
member.param: The starting index of the range to search
The length of the range to search
The implementation to use when comparing elements or null to use the implementation of each element
member.returns: The index of the specified value in the mList, if value is found; otherwise, a negative number. If value is not found and value is less than one or more elements in the list, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of the index of the first element that is larger than the value. If value is not found and value is greater than all elements in array, the negative number returned is the bitwise complement of (the index of the last element plus 1). If this method is called with a non-sorted list, the return value can be incorrect and a negative number could be returned, even if the value is present in the list

member.name: T:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer
member.summary: Tokenizes a string into a collection of values.

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.RegexTokenizeWords
member.remarks:
Pattern explanation:
1st capture group.
Match any character other than a word character atomically at least once.

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.#ctor(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Creates a StringTokenizer with the given . If the IFormatProvider is null, use the thread's IFormatProvider info. ',' is used as the list separator, unless it's the same as the decimal separator. If it *is*, then e.g. "23,5" can't be determined to be one number or two. In this case, use ";" as the separator.

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.#ctor(System.String,System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Initializes the StringTokenizer with the string to tokenize, the character which represents quotes and the list separator.

member.name: P:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.IsSeparatorFound
member.summary: Determines whether a valid separator could be found in the string.

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.GetCurrentToken
member.summary: Returns the mCurrent token if present, else null.
member.returns: A , representing the mCurrent token

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.GetNumericListSeparator(System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Get the numeric list separator for a given IFormatProvider. Separator is a comma [,] if the decimal separator is not a comma, else a semicolon [;] is used.
member.returns: The separator character

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.NextToken
member.summary: Advances to the next token.
member.returns: True if next token was found, false if at end of string

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.NextTokenRequired
member.summary: Advances to the next token, throwing an exception if not present.
member.returns: The next token found

member.summary: Advances to the next token, throwing an exception if not present.
member.returns: The next token found

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.NextToken(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Advances to the next token.
member.returns: True if next token was found, false if at end of string

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.NextToken(System.Boolean,System.Char)
member.summary: Advances to the next token. A separator character can be specified, which overrides the one previously set.
member.returns: True if next token was found, false if at end of string

member.name: M:BlueHeron.Collections.StringTokenizer.Split(System.String)
member.summary: Simply tokenizes a string into words (where word is the regex definition of a word).
member.returns: An

member.summary: Initialize the StringTokenizer with the string to tokenize, the char which represents quotes and the list separator.

member.exception: Empty token or extra data encountered
